content: instructions just click on the icon but if for some reason the links do not work in your pdf you can find these two playlists on my channel https //www youtube com/@acanthuscrochet/playlists stitch abbreviations chain chain sl slip_stitch decrease single_crochet decrease st stitch double_crochet double_crochet tc treble_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ** repeat the section between the two stars increase single_crochet increase total number of stitches in a row single_crochet single_crochet fabulous freddie the pharaoh mummy © 2024 acanthus crochet 3 general instructions most of the parts are worked in continuous rounds without joining it is helpful to use stitch markers or a separate of piece of different colored yarn to mark the start of each row for many elements the pattern uses the magic_ring to start but if preferred it is also possible to start with a chain ring instead this method consists of chaining 4 slip stitching into the first chain to form a ring and then making the starting stitches into the ring space for more information on this method there is a small tutorial on youtube instructions body us e yarn color a we will work the body starting at top and then working down the body is broader at the top than the bottom so we will start with a chain instead of a magic_ring to create an oval shape in essence increasing the row work the same as when we create a round shape for a round we normally repeat a sequence consisting of *single crochets and an increase* six times per row the difference is that we split these into two half rounds of three sequences each which are then separated by a straight section unfortunately when we start with a chain the end/start of each row is in the middle of one of the half round sections this makes the pattern more convoluted and annoying but by moving the starting stitch forward by one between row 1 and 2 we can start each row with the straight section there is a short youtube video that demonstrate row 1-2 step by step row 1 chain 6 1 single_crochet into the second chain from the hook 1 single_crochet in the next chain note that this will be the starting point for the next row so if you are using row markers mark this stitch 2 single_crochet 3 single_crochet into last chain now work on the other side of the chain 3 single_crochet increase in last chain it should already have one single_crochet in sl into first single_crochet to close the sl will now be the last stitch of the row by moving the starting stitch forward with one it makes the instructions needed for increasing the row much simpler 12 fabulous freddie the pharaoh mummy © 2024 acanthus crochet 4 row 2 start this row in the second single_crochet row 15-17 single_crochet in each st around 42 made in row 1 3
